security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill containing only documentation and markdown examples. No executable code, network operations, or filesystem modifications. Contains teaching content about command development patterns.

content.user_title: Create slash commands for Claude Code
content.value_statement: Creating custom slash commands requires understanding file format, YAML configuration, and dynamic features. This skill provides comprehensive guidance on building reusable, powerful commands with arguments, file references, and bash execution.
actual_capabilities: Create slash commands as Markdown files with YAML frontmatter
Include file contents with @ syntax file references
Execute bash commands inline using !` backtick syntax
Organize commands with namespacing and subdirectories
Integrate commands with plugin agents, skills, and hooks
limitations: Commands are written for Claude consumption, not as user-facing messages
Plugin-specific features like CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT require plugin context
Complex workflows may require multiple coordinated commands
Commands cannot modify themselves or other command files

use_cases.title: Create project-specific commands
use_cases.description: Define reusable workflows for code review, testing, and deployment that team members can access via /command-name.

use_cases.title: Bundle commands with plugins

prompt_templates.title: Basic command creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new slash command called /review-code that reviews files for quality issues. Include description and allowed-tools for Read access.

prompt_templates.title: Command with arguments
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a slash command that accepts a PR number as argument. Use $1 placeholder and include argument-hint in frontmatter.

prompt_templates.title: File references
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a command that uses @ syntax to reference configuration files. Show how to load multiple files in one command.

prompt_templates.title: Plugin command
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a plugin command that uses ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} to reference scripts and templates in the plugin directory.

output_examples.input: Create a command to deploy to staging
output: - Body: Instructions to Claude about deployment process
- Bash: Use !` to check git status before deployment

best_practices: Write commands as instructions TO Claude, not messages TO users. Use imperative form like 'Review this code for issues.'
Use the most restrictive allowed-tools setting. For read-only analysis, specify Read and Grep rather than all tools.
Document arguments with argument-hint field. Use descriptive names like [pr-number] instead of arg1.
anti_patterns: Writing commands as user-facing messages: 'This command will review your code' instead of 'Review this code for issues.'
Using overly broad allowed-tools settings like Bash(*) when Bash(git:*) would suffice
Omitting argument-hint documentation, making commands harder to discover and use

faq.question: What file format do slash commands use?
faq.answer: Slash commands are Markdown files with .md extension stored in .claude/commands/, ~/.claude/commands/, or plugin-name/commands/ directories.

faq.question: How do I pass arguments to a command?
faq.answer: Use $1, $2, $3 for positional arguments or $ARGUMENTS for all arguments as a single string. Define argument-hint in frontmatter for user documentation.

faq.question: Can commands execute bash scripts?
faq.answer: Yes, use !`command` syntax to execute bash and include output. Add Bash to allowed-tools and consider command filters like Bash(git:*).

faq.question: Are command contents visible to users?
faq.answer: Command files exist on the system but their content is only visible through Claude. Users invoke commands via /name and see results, not the command text.

faq.question: Why is my command not appearing in /help?
faq.answer: Verify file is in correct location, has .md extension, contains valid frontmatter, and restart Claude Code after adding new commands.

faq.question: How are plugin commands different from project commands?
faq.answer: Plugin commands use ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} for portable paths, can be auto-discovered from plugins, and integrate with plugin agents and skills.
